name: 黃柏鈞
objective: This course offers a broad introduction to computer programming and object-oriented programming. The major programming language focused will be C++, one of the "big 3" programming languages according to the TIOBE survey in Dec. 2017. We shall also cover essential data structures, e.g., linked list and binary search trees, modern development tools, e.g., Make, Subversion, Git, and unit testing tools, object-oriented programing paradigms, design patterns, and refactoring. How to plan a real-world-level project shall also be discussed. From this course, students can expect to be equipped with essential know-hows for computer programming and object-oriented programming, both of which are indispensable in the foreseeable future.
schedule:
Week 1. Introduction
Week 2. Basic language facilities; strings, vectors, and arrays
Week 3. Expressions and statements; iteration and recursion
Week 4. Functions and macros; structures, unions, and classes
Week 5. The C++ standard template library (STL) (I)
Week 6. The C++ standard template library (STL) (II)
Week 7. Advanced classes: copy control, operator overloading, inheritance, polymorphism, and more.
Week 8. Midterm examination (上機考)
Week 9. Design patterns (I): GoF patterns
Week 10. Design patterns (II): GoF patterns
Week 11. Design patterns (III): small memory patterns
Week 12. Design patterns (IV): small memory patterns
Week 13. Large-scale programming in C++
Week 14. Refactoring (I)
Week 15. Refactoring (II)
Week 16. Refactoring to patterns
Week 17. What's new in C++11 and C++17
Week 18. Semester project open demo (期末專題程式公開展示)
scorePolicy:
In-class participation 20%
Homework assignment 25%
Midterm exam 25%
Final exam 30%
